_[other/travis/env-linux.sh, line 11 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36#-KPPdnfHzLyiY_wkS629:-KPPdnfII3kHIXte-Ruy:b-5ywv6l) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/ff6c471b9ec1e95a094ec6ace47d80bbfa6dd2b9/other/travis/env-linux.sh#L11)):_

> ``` Shell
> export MAKE=make
> export PREFIX=$PWD/_install
> export NPROC=`nproc`
> ```

IF $TRAVIS NPROC=2?

---

_[other/travis/toxcore-script, line 15 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36#-KPPcwaTHyByhxH1B-70:-KPPcwaUi2eDmYYz-srx:b-fshww1) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/ff6c471b9ec1e95a094ec6ace47d80bbfa6dd2b9/other/travis/toxcore-script#L15)):_

> ```
> # Build toxcore and run tests.
> export CFLAGS="-O3 -fprofile-arcs -ftest-coverage -DTRAVIS_ENV=1"
> RUN $CMAKE -B$BUILD_DIR -H. -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX:PATH=$PREFIX -DLOGGING=ON -DDEBUG=ON
> ```

-DDEBUG vs -DTOX_DEBUG?

---

_[toxcore/DHT.c, line 2627 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36#-KPPcehw9HYdPboN9F7r:-KPPcehxG6JKf2IpAIfp:bnl6b5l) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/ff6c471b9ec1e95a094ec6ace47d80bbfa6dd2b9/toxcore/DHT.c#L2627)):_

> ``` C
> #ifdef TOX_DEBUG
> 
>         default:
> ```

unrelated to this PR, but it's here anyway. Are we sure the default should be wrapped in the ifdef? As opposed to the content of the default?

---

_Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36)_

<!-- Sent from Reviewable.io -->

Review status: all files reviewed at latest revision, 3 unresolved discussions. --- _[other/travis/env-linux.sh, line 11 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36#-KPPdnfHzLyiY_wkS629:-KPPeSeBW_Ce7maHUGPt:b-u0uxz9) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/ff6c471b9ec1e95a094ec6ace47d80bbfa6dd2b9/other/travis/env-linux.sh#L11)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > IF $TRAVIS NPROC=2? >
> I think on travis `nproc` is in fact 2. --- _[other/travis/toxcore-script, line 15 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36#-KPPcwaTHyByhxH1B-70:-KPPeZc6X5YnPh60Yf0H:bha6cyr) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/ff6c471b9ec1e95a094ec6ace47d80bbfa6dd2b9/other/travis/toxcore-script#L15)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > -DDEBUG vs -DTOX_DEBUG? >
> Yes, the cmake option is called DEBUG. It enables -DTOX_DEBUG in the C compiler, and may enable other things in the future. --- _[toxcore/DHT.c, line 2627 [r2]](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36#-KPPcehw9HYdPboN9F7r:-KPPekt4VYXQZQp19sx6:b-1zs5j0) ([raw file](https://github.com/toktok/toxcore/blob/ff6c471b9ec1e95a094ec6ace47d80bbfa6dd2b9/toxcore/DHT.c#L2627)):_
Previously, GrayHatter (Gregory Mullen) wrote… > unrelated to this PR, but it's here anyway. Are we sure the default should be wrapped in the ifdef? As opposed to the content of the default? >
> It doesn't really matter. The ifdef could wrap only the `fprintf` or the whole `default` statement. Semantically, it's equivalent. --- _Comments from [Reviewable](https://reviewable.io:443/reviews/toktok/toxcore/36)_

commit.message:
Make tox_callback_friend_name stateless.

See #27 and #40 for details.
